steps.text: Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner to remove mold release materials.
Sand old or new gelcoat with DA sander and grade 80+ abrasive discs to remove imperfections.
Apply dry guide coat and re-sand for even texture.
Mix Marine Blister Repair Filler and apply, then feather and sand.
Apply Marine Premium Filler in tight coat and sand with grade 120+ abrasive discs.
Finish by sanding repair area with grade 220+ abrasive discs.
Finish repair area with 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II grade 220+.
Ensure surface is dry and mask areas with 3M tapes and Purple Premium Plus Masking Film.
Mix gelcoat in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 disposable spray cup.
Apply gelcoat using a performance spray gun.
Follow the gelcoat finishing process (6-Step Process).
Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Sand refine with Hookit 320+ and then 400+ grade abrasives or start with P800 grade Foam Discs.
Refine sand scratch using P1200 grade Foam Discs.
Compound surface with Perfect-It Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound and Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad.
Polish with Perfect-It Gelcoat Compound + Polish and wool compounding pad.
Apply 3M Perfect-It protection.
Ensure surface is dry before starting.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Using a DA sander with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 80+ grade abrasive discs, sand the surface and clean it.
Apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
After it sets, apply dry guide coat and sand with 120+ grade abrasive discs, then finish sanding with 220+ grade.
Apply masking tapes and film as described in the gelcoat process.
Mix primer in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun held 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Apply dry guide coat and sand the primer with 320+ grade abrasive discs, then repeat with 400+ grade.
Mix paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Refer to the following page for the finishing process.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 220+ grade abrasive.
Mix and apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Allow the filler to cure and sand with 120+ grade abrasive, then finish with 220+ grade.
Apply masking tapes and film as described in previous processes.
Mix bottom paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup (remove lid filter). Use a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun, holding it 15cm-20cm from the surface to apply the paint.
Prepare surface for paint application.
Apply the paint.

constraints.text: The customer is responsible for evaluating product suitability, conducting a workplace hazard assessment, following regulations, and using safety equipment.
Products are intended for industrial use only and must be used in compliance with health and safety regulations.
